info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued December 21 at 5:49AM MST until December 23 at 10:00AM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills possible. Temperatures will fall into the teens with winds in the 20 to 30 mph range. Wind chills will fall as low as 5 below zero. * WHERE...Otero county in New Mexico, East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet and Otero Mesa. Hudspeth county in Texas, Northern Hudspeth Highlands/Hueco Mountains, Salt Basin and Southern Hudspeth Highlands. * WHEN...From late Thursday night through Friday morning. * IMPACTS....Well below freezing temperatures will have significant impact to people, pets, plants and pipes. Dangerously low wind chills could be life threatening to pets and people who do not have shelter and heat.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Take steps now to protect tender plants and pipes from the cold. Ensure that people and pets have heat and shelter.
